Articles.Content:
I'm looking forward to the update. I've not actually used Chatterer before, but I think that's going to change.

Though, I'm curious, what's the GUI mod that you're running in that video? It shows the orbital information such as the AP/PE, heading, and other info? It looks pretty useful.

I hope you do try it. It adds some nice flavor to the game.

The info plugin I use is VOID. I never leave the launchpad without it.

I hope you do try it. It adds some nice flavor to the game.

Any word on the update? Chatterer is already one of must-have "simple" add-ons, along with Aviation Lights. Really looking forward to this new build.

Any word on the update?

The word is patience. I don't have much free time but I'm trying to do a little bit every day.
Sounds good, Chatterer has become a must have for me.

I was trying out the muziker, really nice sound effects. I always like ambient space sounds. I'm really looking forward to it be added inyo this mod. As the muziker mod on its own didn't have a lot of options, this would give it some.

Indeed. What parts would you hide? I'm thinking the filters and copy/paste buttons certainly can be hidden for basic use. Maybe the Add/Rmv buttons for beeps? Hiding these would pretty much take it back to how it looked at 0.5 (OP image).

Sorry; long time, no respond. Yes, what you've mentioned would definitely do. Even being able to expand/contract the beeps and chatter sections independantly would really tidy things up. I know I don't need to see the booping menu on manned ships, and the chatter menu for my probes.

EDIT: Actually, I really liked ol' .1, with nothing but a volume control. What if it was just volume controls (three, I guess; for chattering booping, and the upcoming muziker-ing), with an options button that pops out the rest?

Edited November 6, 2013 by BigFatStupidHead

Would it be possible for all the Mods that create an on screen button to share the code for the ability to move that button?

Or all coordinate on making a 'toolbar' mod to dock them to?

I know that Chatterer already has this. Perhaps you could pass the code around.

I'm cross-posting this on multiple threads.

Would it be possible for all the Mods that create an on screen button to share the code for the ability to move that button?

Or all coordinate on making a 'toolbar' mod to dock them to?

I know that Chatterer already has this. Perhaps you could pass the code around.

I'm cross-posting this on multiple threads.

Posted the code for that last time this came up. Didn't get much traction.

Chatterer 0.5.7 download link now up in the OP. Have a try and let me know what's good, what sucks and what else should be added. If you find a bug please include a log file with your post. "It doesn't work. Fix it" is not going to get you anywhere.

.22 chatterer?

This is turned out to be a good weeked indeed. Thanks.
Thank you very much for this, Chatterer is one of my "Must Have" mods for KSP

Chatterer 0.5.7 download link now up in the OP. Have a try and let me know what's good, what sucks and what else should be added. If you find a bug please include a log file with your post. "It doesn't work. Fix it" is not going to get you anywhere.

too bad it is very late here in Germany..but will totally test it soon. So good to see ,there is an update
I'll give the new one a try. Seems to take up a lot more space - 42MB instead of less than 5MB for the 0.5 version. Why's that?

Seems to take up a lot more space - 42MB instead of less than 5MB for the 0.5 version. Why's that?

There are a lot of large new audio files included now.

Engine hum, nice!

The UI seems to forget and change its layout though - will have to test more after work.

There are a lot of large new audio files included now.

Hm, will have to either pick the ones I want to use or find a way to shrink them. My RAM is becoming more and more ... I mean less and less ...

I'm using v0.22 sandbox mode. I d/l the new zip halfway down the first post. Dump into gamedata - just like all my other mods (I have a few). Launch game.

No chatting noises and no 'microphone' icon. It seems the dll is not loading. I notice there is no part in the zip file? Is that right? I have quite a few mods so I'm not ruling out a conflict. Thx.

(yes - I removed all previous versions)

Edit: working now - there is a conflict. I removed flight recorder, persistent trails, telemachus and rcsbuildaid then restarted. Chatterer then worked. So there is a conflict with one or all of those.

Edited November 11, 2013 by togfox
It's definitely not with RCS Build Aid - I use those together just fine.

I'm using v0.22 sandbox mode. I d/l the new zip halfway down the first post. Dump into gamedata - just like all my other mods (I have a few). Launch game.

No chatting noises and no 'microphone' icon. It seems the dll is not loading. I notice there is no part in the zip file? Is that right? I have quite a few mods so I'm not ruling out a conflict. Thx.

(yes - I removed all previous versions)

Edit: working now - there is a conflict. I removed flight recorder, persistent trails, telemachus and rcsbuildaid then restarted. Chatterer then worked. So there is a conflict with one or all of those.

Can you include a log file? This is way too vague to troubleshoot effectively.
All elements are working error free on linux. And the gui is lightweight and uncluttered. Great work!

It's not telemachus I have that installed and it works.

I'm using v0.22 sandbox mode. I d/l the new zip halfway down the first post. Dump into gamedata - just like all my other mods (I have a few). Launch game.

No chatting noises and no 'microphone' icon. It seems the dll is not loading. I notice there is no part in the zip file? Is that right? I have quite a few mods so I'm not ruling out a conflict. Thx.

(yes - I removed all previous versions)

Edit: working now - there is a conflict. I removed flight recorder, persistent trails, telemachus and rcsbuildaid then restarted. Chatterer then worked. So there is a conflict with one or all of those.

Ill add those mods one at a time and see at what point it breaks. Not hard to do.

Like the new sounds btw. Awesome mod. Awesome options. That breathing sound is genius. Nice work.
Can I just delete the sounds I don't want? That would primarily be everything except for the voices and beeps.

I deleted everything I did not want - seems to work - but I left one ambient in and like the ship hum so far.

I am only using Apollo, one STS (sound the same annoying way anyway ), half the beeps, the ship hums and left in one ambient file to be safe.

I deleted everything I did not want - seems to work - but I left one ambient in and like the ship hum so far.

I am only using Apollo, one STS (sound the same annoying way anyway ), half the beeps, the ship hums and left in one ambient file to be safe.

Cool! Thanks.
If I deleted my files I don't get the chatterer icon in flight.
